Oracle " to " the original meaning of the word used to indicate to. For example, "Compilation" 27809: "Wang is to mourning." " mourning " is the name of the place, and the whole sentence refers to the place where the king has arrived at the mourning. In addition, the word "as in" is common in oracle bone inscriptions, which can be interpreted as the verb " to ", which is used to point out the lower limit of a certain type of thing. "Collection" 12324 is: "From now on, it will rain in Gengchen." It means whether it will rain from now to Gengchen. In addition, the word "solstice" is often used in oracle bone inscriptions, which is suspected to be the name of sacrifice. " To " can also be used as " to " to explain the cause, such as "Complete Collection" 17451: "Many ghosts (fear) dreams, not to ğ¡†¥ (worry)", refers to more fears but dreams do not cause worry.

In addition, " to " can also be followed by the preposition " to ", which can be interpreted as "to reach", such as the Sanshi disc: "From the south of Yushe, as for Dagu (lake)." It refers to the transition from Yushui to the south to reach the big lake. The word " to " can be used as a name.

Radicals: è‡³  (mole)
Meaning Mnemonic
Dig up a mole and you attain a mole status. You're always trying to attain a new level for yourself and now you get to be on the mole level!
It's actually pretty easy to attain mole status. Just stand in a field. Wait for the ground to move under you and shove your hand in the earth. Blam! An achievement pops up above your head and you're there.
Reading Mnemonic
Mole isn't enough, you want to attain sheep (ã—) status next. Everyone knows it goes human > mole> sheep. Now you need to stand in the field with the mole and get a sheep to come over.
If you can attain two animal levels in one day you'll be a legend on the leaderboards.
